comments.body: @beckermr I don't know either. The download link by standard url doesn't work. But should. Republishing package on pypi doesn't help. But pip installs correctly as it uses this very hashed url as I put in the recipe. Strange...
@beckermr  I'm not sure if this hash url is permanent but it's stable enough to build a conda package.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +7,11 @@
source:
  # url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url: https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/f0/63/3c3ea3a28821bdc620b205cbc66c57437ed894bbd9a77970973ad7cd81bd/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 2c9add9b3349dbad2dc875797713d901a22151f67a66d7157d282267ad3199d7
